greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered bicoverings of an unlabeled n-set.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: E.g.f. for ordered k-block bicoverings of an unlabeled n-set is exp(-x-x^2/2*y/(1-y)) * Sum_{k>=0} 1/(1-y)^binomial(k,2)*x^k/k!.
example: There are 23 ordered bicoverings of an unlabeled 3-set, 7 3-block bicoverings:
program: (PARI) seq(n)={my(m=3*n\2, y='y + O('y^(n+1))); Vec(subst(Pol(serlaplace(exp(-x - x^2*y/(2*(1-y)) + O(x*x^m))*sum(k=0, m, 1/(1-y)^binomial(k, 2)*x^k/k!))), x, 1))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 30 2020
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 25 2001
